meanings.definition: Continue to live or exist, especially in spite of danger or hardship.
meanings.sent1: The little plant survived the harsh winter by staying inside.
meanings.sent2: She survived the storm by finding shelter in a sturdy building.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous cat survived its daring climb up the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude helped her survive the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The old tree has survived many storms, standing tall and strong.

meanings.definition: Remain alive after the death of someone else.
meanings.sent1: He survived his grandfather and inherited his old watch.
meanings.sent2: She survived her pet fish and got a new one to keep her company.
meanings.sent3: The plant survived the winter, but sadly, the flowers did not.
meanings.sent4: The family survived the loss of their beloved dog by adopting a new puppy.
meanings.sent5: The old book survived many readers, each passing it on to the next generation.

meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins survived the passing of time, telling stories of the past.
meanings.sent2: The wise turtle survived all its companions, living for many years.
meanings.sent3: The sturdy bridge survived the flood, unlike the fragile houses nearby.
meanings.sent4: His legacy survived him, inspiring generations to come.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree survived the forest fire, a symbol of resilience and strength.
